education.studyType: Bachelor of Science (Honours) Computer Science Cooperative Program
courses: Undergraduate Thesis Project in Remotely Operated Mobile Robotics
Founder and Co-President of TMU Muay Thai Club

work.name: Environment and Climate Change Canada
work.description: Government of Canada department focused on environmental protection and weather services
work.summary: Optimized radar processing systems and built monitoring solutions for weather data infrastructure.
highlights: Refactored 'Dispatcher' module, replacing inefficient linear search logic with a custom SQLite solution. Reduced complexity from O(n) to O(log n), dramatically improving querying performance, memory usage, and scalability
Delivered multiple production-ready bug fixes and new features with full unit test coverage, thorough documentation, and code reviews
Built and maintained Grafana dashboards to monitor live and development radar processing environments. Investigated server-side errors, performed root cause analysis, and implemented long-term fixes

work.name: Ontario Power Generation
work.description: Ontario's largest electricity generator and clean energy provider
work.summary: Developed automation tools and analyzed supply chain data for nuclear power operations.
highlights: Developed TWEEKs, an internal automation tool that reduced report generation time from over an hour to mere secondsâ€”streamlining part risk assessments and enhancing cross-departmental coordination
Analyzed historical part usage data to identify low-stock parts required for future projects, resulting in timely procurement. Highlighted over-stocked materials for Asset Recovery initiative
Acted as the Supply Chain liaison for Nuclear Refurbishment Projects, coordinating with project leaders and vendors to optimize parts delivery and project planning timelines

projects.name: MATILDA: Remote Control Bomb Defusal Robot
projects.description: Undergraduate thesis project developing a remotely operated robot for hazardous environment operations. Supervised by Dr. Alexander Ferworn.
highlights: Developed a UDP-based control system to transmit data packets from a PS5 controller on a laptop to an ESP32 microcontroller connected to a Sabertooth motor driver and arm controller, enabling precise remote actuation of the robot and its 6DOF arm.
Developed a multi-camera video streaming pipeline using Raspberry Pi and WebRTC; streamed real-time feeds from three onboard cameras to a Flask-based operator dashboard for situational awareness.
Deployed and configured a private mesh network of five routers across a university engineering building to ensure low-latency communication and uninterrupted control during live operation tests.
Contributed to the mechanical integration of the robotic system, including 3D printing, mounting, and calibration of structural components and the robotic arm assembly.

projects.name: GameScout
projects.description: Game recommendation system developed for McGill Hacks 2025 hackathon
highlights: Led a team of 4 students to develop a functional game recommendation system within 24 hours during McGill Hacks 2025.
Implemented collaborative and content-based filtering algorithms using Scikit-learn to generate personalized recommendations based on user preferences.
Developed a web applicaiton interface by integrating a Flask-powered backend with a responsive front-end, allowing users to input preferences and receive dynamic suggestions.

projects.name: JobGPT: AI-Powered Resume & Cover Letter Generator
projects.description: A full-stack web application that leverages Large Language Models to automatically generate tailored resumes and cover letters for job applications.
highlights: Leverages the OpenAI API to dynamically tailor resumes and cover letters to specific job descriptions, ensuring alignment with a master resume to maintain factual accuracy.
Developed a full-stack application featuring a React front-end for user interaction and a Flask back-end to manage API calls.
Integrated an SQLite database for persistent storage, enabling robust job application tracking and statistical analysis of past applications.
Created a complex Playwright scraper to query and scrape job postings from LinkedIn and save into the database.
Automated the final output to a professional, one-page PDF format for both the resume and cover letter, ready for submission.

projects.name: Elev8 AI Solutions: AI Voice Receptionist
projects.description: A real-time AI receptionist system that handles incoming calls using OpenAI's GPT-4o Realtime API and Twilio's telephony services, providing professional customer service and company information.
highlights: Developed a real-time voice AI system using OpenAI's GPT-4o Realtime API with WebSocket streaming for instant conversational responses, enabling natural voice interactions with callers.
Built a FastAPI backend with WebSocket support to handle bidirectional audio streaming between Twilio's telephony service and OpenAI's real-time API, ensuring seamless voice communication.
Integrated Twilio's Media Streams API to capture and process incoming audio in real-time, converting it to the format required by OpenAI's Realtime API for voice-to-voice conversations.
Implemented secure API key management using environment variables and deployed the system using ngrok for public webhook accessibility, enabling Twilio to route calls to the local development server.
Created a professional AI receptionist persona that introduces callers and answers questions about services, and provides company information in a conversational manner.

projects.name: Rozer's Barber Station: Full-Stack Booking System
projects.description: A comprehensive barbershop management system with real-time booking, SMS notifications, and admin dashboard built for a local barbershop in Brampton, Ontario.
highlights: Developed a full-stack web application using a modern tech stack featuring a responsive UI, animated hero sections, service cards, and realtime booking form.
Implemented a live booking system with Supabase backend that handles multi-service bookings, dynamic time slot generation based on barber schedules, and conflict detection to prevent double-bookings.
Built an automated SMS notification system using Twilio API that sends booking confirmations to customers and barbers, appointment reminders, and follow-up messages.

Created a comprehensive admin dashboard with bcrypt-secured authentication, real-time booking management, visual weekly schedule grids per barber, and CRUD operations for employees, services, and schedules.
Integrated Google Reviews API to display customer testimonials and implemented a Twilio webhook for SMS-based booking management allowing customers to cancel appointments via text message.

projects.name: Vector Space Model Search Engine
projects.description: Custom search engine implementation using vector space model approach
highlights: Built a search engine from scratch, using the Vector Space Model approach. Implemented TF-IDF weighting, tokenization, and stop-word removal for accurate document-query matching.
Designed and built an inverted index structure to enable fast top-10 result retrieval across large text datasets.
Developed a modular pre-processing pipeline for flexible text normalization, improving search relevance and performance.

projects.name: VALORANT Auto Music Player
projects.description: Automated music controller that synchronizes with in-game events
highlights: Built an automated music controller that synchronizes audio playback with in-game events in VALORANT by analyzing screen state using OpenCV and interfacing with the Windows API.
Implemented logic to dynamically pause or resume music based on round transitions, enhancing user experience without manual input.
Designed a user-friendly GUI in Tkinter to manage playlists, adjust volume, and configure automation settings in real-time.

projects.name: Computer Vision Object Recognition
projects.description: Real-time object recognition system combining traditional CV with deep learning.
highlights: Built a real-time object recognition system combining traditional computer vision techniques with deep learning models for accurate and responsive detection.
Enabled custom training and fine-tuning of models to support domain-specific object recognition use cases.
Developed an intuitive visualization interface for live camera input, annotated detections, and interactive testing.

projects.name: Netflix Movie Recommender System
projects.description: Custom recommendation engine using collaborative and content-based filtering.
highlights: Designed and implemented a custom recommendation engine from scratch using collaborative and content-based filtering logic based on user ratings and viewing history.
Preprocessed and analyzed large datasets with Pandas to optimize performance and ensure low-latency recommendations.
Built a dynamic web interface in Streamlit to allow users to receive personalized movie suggestions in real-time.

projects.name: BoomBot
projects.description: 2D physics-based platformer game with explosion-based movement mechanics
highlights: Designed and developed a 2D physics-based platformer where the player navigates by strategically detonating bombs to launch the character across obstacles and reach the level objective.
Engineered core game mechanics using custom physics logic in p5.play, including explosion-based propulsion, collision detection, health tracking, and level progression.
Built multiple handcrafted levels with increasing difficulty and dynamic interactions to encourage experimentation and spatial problem-solving.

projects.name: Network Routing Algorithm Visualizer
projects.description: A Python program to visualize the routing taken by the Djikstra's and Bellman-Ford Algorthms. Uses Tkinter, NetworkX, and Matplotlib.
highlights: Developed an interactive GUI using Tkinter, allowing users to create custom network topologies and visualize algorithm execution step-by-step.
Utilized NetworkX for graph data structures and Matplotlib to create dynamic, animated visualizations of the pathfinding process for both Dijkstra's and Bellman-Ford algorithms.
